imt: seek.1\textsc{sg} \textsc{dom}.the /{ } the doctor
src: Busco al /{ } *el médico.
trs: I am seeking the doctor.

imt: sent.1\textsc{sg} \textsc{dom} my sister to Caracas
src: Envié a mi hermana a Caracas.
trs: I sent my sister to Caracas.

imt: the teacher introduced.3\textsc{sg} {} his wife to the students
src: El maestro presentó Ø su mujer a los alumnos.
trs: The teacher introduced his wife to the students.

imt: ??/*the teacher introduced.3\textsc{sg} \textsc{dom} his wife to the students
src: ??/*El maestro presentó a su mujer a los alumnos.
trs: The teacher introduced his wife to the students.

imt: the teacher \textsc{dat}.3\textsc{sg} introduced.\textsc{3sg} \textsc{dom} his wife to Juan
src: El maestro le presentó a su mujer a Juan.
trs: The teacher introduced his wife to Juan.’ (judgement according to \citealt[20]{CompanyCompany2001Multiple})

imt: \textsc{dat}.\textsc{3sg} sent.\textsc{3pl} \textsc{dom} all the injured to the doctor
src: *Le enviaron a todos los heridos a la doctora.
trs: They sent all the injured to the doctor.’ (judgement according to \citealt[31]{Fabregas2013Differential})

imt: and gave.\textsc{3sg} Hercules to Manilop \textsc{dom} the queen Anthipa his sister
src: E dio Ercules a Manilop a la reyna Anthipa, su Hermana.
trs: And Hercules gave his sister, Queen Anthipa, to Manilop.’ (GEII (General Estoria, segunda parte), 21, 13th century, quoted after \citealt[167]{Ortiz2011Construcciones})

imt: he gave.\textsc{3sg} {} his daughters to those two infants in.front.of all his rich men
src: El dio Ø sus fijas a aquellos dos infantes ante todos sus ricos omnes.
trs: He gave his daughters to those two princes in front of all his rich men.’ (GE (General Estoria), 344, 13th century, quoted after \citealt[168]{Ortiz2011Construcciones})

imt: to Mendo son of sister younger \textsc{dat}.\textsc{3sg} want.\textsc{1sg} give.\textsc{inf} \textsc{dom} Leonor
src: A Mendo, hijo de hermana menor, le quiero dar a Leonor.
trs: To Mendo, son of (my) younger sister, I want to give Leonor.

imt: even if \textsc{dat.3pl} gave.\textsc{3pl} {} half woman to each one.\textsc{masc} would.be.\textsc{3sg} less the damage
src: Aun si les dieran Ø media mujer a cada uno, fuera menor el daño.
trs: Even if they gave half a woman to each one (of them), the damage would be less.’ (Castro, Guillén de.\,(1569–1631), El conde de Irlos.)

imt: know.1.\textsc{sg} \textsc{dom} this actor
src: Conozco *(a) este actor.
trs: I know this actor.

imt: know.1.\textsc{sg} {} this film
src: Conozco (*a) esta película.
trs: I know this film.

imt: in this recipe the milk can substitute the/\textsc{dom}.the egg
src: En esta receta la leche puede sustituir *el/al huevo.
trs: In this recipe the milk can substitute the egg.

imt: saw.\textsc{1sg} \textsc{dom} the/a woman
src: Vi *(a) la/una mujer.
trs: I saw the / a woman.

imt: need.\textsc{3pl} \textsc{dom} an assistant that know.\textsc{3sg} English
src: Necesitan (a) un ayudante que sepa inglés.
trs: They need an assistant who knows English.

imt: they.need {} waiter
src: Necesitan (*a) camarero.
trs: They need a waiter.

imt: *(\textsc{dom}) many students, already them knew.1\textsc{sg}
src: *(A) muchos estudiantes, ya los conocía.
trs: Many students I already knew.

imt: very brought.\textsc{3pl} the big wealths many herds of sheep and of cows
src: Tanto traen las grandes ganançias, \textbf{muchos} \textbf{gañados} \textbf{de} \textbf{ovejas} \textbf{e} \textbf{de} \textbf{vacas}.
trs: They brought such great wealth, many herds of sheep and cows.’  %(Cid, 480-481)

imt: Ema and Tito observe.\textsc{pst}.\textsc{3sg} \textsc{dom} Ana
src: Ema y Tito observaron a Ana.
trs: Ema and Tito observed Ana.

imt: Ana was observed by Ema and Tito
src: Ana fue observada por Ema y Tito.
trs: Ana was observed by Ema and Tito.

imt: {} see.\textsc{pst}.\textsc{2sg} \textsc{dom} Kiko
src: A: ¿Viste a Kiko?
trs: Did you see Kiko?

imt: {} Yes, \textsc{acc}.\textsc{3sg} see.\textsc{pst}.\textsc{1sg}
src: B: Sí, lo vi.
trs: Yes, I saw him.

imt: \textsc{dom} Claudito \textsc{acc}.\textsc{3sg} see.\textsc{pst}.\textsc{1sg} for first time in December
src: A Claudito lo vi por primera vez en diciembre.
trs: Claudito, I saw him for the first time in December.

imt: the teacher \textsc{dat}.\textsc{3sg} present.\textsc{pst.3sg} (\textsc{dom}) his son to.the student
src: El maestro le presentó (a) su hijo al alumno.
trs: The teacher presented his son to the student.

imt: Juan (\textsc{dat.3sg}) give.\textsc{pst.3sg} a charity \textsc{dat} our neighbor yesterday
src: Juan (le) dio una limosna a nuestro vecino ayer.
trs: Juan gave our neighbor a charity yesterday.

imt: Juan present.\textsc{pst.3sg} a book to Maria, and Pablo \textsc{dat.3sg} present.\textsc{pst.3sg} flowers
src: Juan regaló un libro a María, y Pablo le regaló flores.
trs: Juan presented a book to Maria and Pablo presented her flowers.

imt: María travel.\textsc{3sg} to Paris, and Ana *\textsc{dat.3sg} / there travel-\textsc{3sg}, too
src: María viaja a París, y Ana *le / allá viaja, también.
trs: María travels to Paris and Ana travels there, too.

imt: introduce.\textsc{pst.3sg} {} the daughter to the guests
src: Presentaron Ø la hija a los invitados.
trs: They introduced the daughter to the guests.

imt: \textsc{dat.3pl} introduce.\textsc{pst.3pl} \textsc{dom} the daughter to the guests
src: *Les presentaron a la hija a los invitados.
trs: 'They introduced the daughter to the guests.’ (\citealt{Campos1999Transitividad}: 1554, fn.\,79)

imt: María made work the Sundays \textsc{dom} an employee
src: María hizo trabajar los domingos a/*Ø un empleado.
trs: María made an employee work on Sundays.

imt: María \textsc{pl}.\textsc{dat} made visit \textsc{dom} a sick \textsc{dat} some employees
src: María les hizo visitar a/Ø un enfermo a/*Ø unas empleadas.
trs: María made some employees visit a sick person.

imt: María saw fall \textsc{dom} a child
src: María vio caer a/*Ø un niño.
trs: María saw a child falling.

imt: María saw \textsc{dat} an employee visit \textsc{dom} a sick
src: María vio a/*Ø una empleada visitar a/Ø un enfermo.
trs: María saw an employee visiting a sick person.

imt: yesterday saw the most of the men \textsc{dom} a child
src: Ayer vieron la mayoría de los hombres a/Ø un niño.
trs: Yesterday most of the men saw a child.’\\

imt: yesterday delivered \textsc{dom} a child \textsc{dat} the majority of the mothers
src: Ayer entregaron a/Ø un niño a la mayoría de las madres.
trs: Yesterday they delivered a child to most of the mothers.’\\

imt: They-returned \textsc{dom} a prisoner to his tribe
src: Devolvieron a/Ø un prisionero a su tribu.
trs: They returned a prisoner to his tribe.
